title: Empanadas Argentinas
description: Crispy pastries filled with seasoned beef, onions, and spices. A classic from Argentina.
author: Maria Rodriguez

steps.description: Prepare the filling by cooking beef with onion and spices.
Make the dough by mixing flour, water, and salt.
Fill and seal the empanadas.
Fry or bake until golden brown.

title: Arepas Venezolanas
description: Cornmeal patties, crispy outside and soft inside, filled with cheese, ham, or shredded beef.
author: María González

steps.description: Mix cornmeal with water and salt until a soft dough forms.
Divide the dough into balls and flatten into discs.
Cook the arepas on a hot griddle on both sides until golden.
Split open and fill with cheese, ham, or shredded beef as desired.

title: Paella Española
description: Saffron-scented rice with seafood, chicken, and vegetables, a Spanish classic.
author: Antonio Lopez

steps.description: Sauté chicken and seafood in a paella pan.
Add rice, saffron, broth, and vegetables.
Cook on low heat until the rice absorbs the liquid.
Let rest and serve directly from the paella pan.

title: Pabellón Criollo
description: Venezuelan national dish: shredded beef, black beans, rice, and fried plantain.
author: José Parra

steps.description: Cook the beef with onion and garlic until tender, then shred.
Prepare the black beans with spices and cook until soft.
Fry the plantains until golden brown.
Serve beef, beans, rice, and plantains together on the plate.

title: Tamales Mexicanos
description: Corn masa filled with savory meats and wrapped in banana leaves, a holiday tradition.
author: Elena Vasquez

steps.description: Prepare the filling by cooking the meat with chilies and spices.
Form the tortillas from the corn masa.
Fill the tortillas and wrap them in banana leaves.
Steam the tamales for several hours.

title: Hallacas Venezolanas
description: Traditional Christmas dish: corn dough filled with stew, wrapped in plantain leaves and boiled.
author: Carmen Salazar

steps.description: Prepare the stew with meats, vegetables, olives, and raisins.
Make the corn dough and spread it on plantain leaves.
Place the stew in the center, fold and tie the hallaca.
Boil the hallacas in water for 1 hour.

title: Arepas Colombianas
description: Cornmeal patties that are crispy outside and soft inside, perfect with cheese.
author: Luis Fernandez

steps.description: Mix cornmeal with water and salt until a soft dough forms.
Divide the dough into balls and flatten into discs.
Cook the arepas on a hot griddle on both sides until golden.
Split open and fill with cheese, ham, or shredded beef as desired.

title: Cachapas Venezolanas
description: Sweet corn pancakes, served with cheese and butter, typical of Venezuelan cuisine.
author: Luis Romero

steps.description: Blend corn with milk, sugar, and salt until smooth.
Pour the mixture onto a hot griddle and cook on both sides.
Serve hot cachapas with cheese and butter as desired.

title: Arroz con Pollo
description: Classic chicken and rice dish with aromatic spices, a staple in Latin American homes.
author: Carlos Mendez

steps.description: Season the chicken with spices and brown in a pot.
Add rice, vegetables, and broth. Cook on low heat.
When the rice is tender, serve hot.

title: Feijoada Brasileña
description: Brazilian black bean stew with pork, sausage, and rice. National dish of Brazil.
author: João Silva

steps.description: Soak the black beans overnight.
Cook the beans with pork and sausages.
Serve with white rice and orange slices.

title: Ceviche Peruano
description: Fresh fish marinated in lime juice with onions, peppers, and cilantro.
author: Miguel Santos

steps.description: Cut the fish into cubes and marinate in lime juice.
Add onion, cilantro, and chopped chili.
Serve cold as an appetizer.

title: Guacamole Mexicano
description: Creamy avocado dip with lime, cilantro, and spices, perfect with tortilla chips.
author: Rosa Martinez

steps.description: Mash the avocados in a bowl.
Add onion, tomato, cilantro, and lime juice.
Mix well and serve with tortilla chips.

title: Horchata Mexicana
description: Creamy rice drink with cinnamon and vanilla, refreshing and sweet.
author: Carmen Diaz

steps.description: Boil rice with cinnamon in water.
Blend cooked rice with milk and sugar.
Strain and serve cold with sprinkled cinnamon.

title: Churros Españoles
description: Crispy fried dough pastries dusted with cinnamon sugar, perfect with hot chocolate.
author: Isabella Torres

steps.description: Mix flour with water and salt until a dough forms.
Heat oil in a deep skillet.
Shape dough into strips and fry until golden.
Coat churros in sugar mixed with cinnamon.

title: Salsa Verde
description: Tangy green salsa made with tomatillos, jalapeños, and fresh herbs.
author: Patricia Gomez

steps.description: Roast tomatillos and jalapeños on a griddle.
Blend roasted tomatillos with cilantro and onion.
Adjust salt and serve with tacos or as a dip.

title: Suspiro Limeño
description: Peruvian dessert with creamy custard base and sweet meringue topping.
author: Ana Castillo

steps.description: Prepare the dulce de leche by cooking milk with sugar.
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form with sugar.
In a glass, layer dulce de leche and top with meringue.
Garnish with cinnamon and serve chilled.

title: Tostones Caribeños
description: Twice-fried plantain slices, crispy and golden, popular in the Caribbean.
author: Juan Perez

steps.description: Cut green plantains into slices.
Fry the slices in hot oil until golden.
Flatten the fried slices and fry again.
Drain on paper towels and season with salt.

title: Pupusas Salvadoreñas
description: Thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, or pork. National dish of El Salvador.
author: Gloria Ramos

steps.description: Mix corn masa with water and salt.
Form balls of masa and flatten them.
Fill with cheese, beans, or meat and seal.
Cook on a hot griddle until golden.

title: Moqueca Brasileña
description: Brazilian fish stew with coconut milk, tomatoes, and cilantro.
author: Fernanda Costa

steps.description: Marinate the fish with lemon, garlic, and salt.
In a pot, cook onion, tomato, and bell pepper.
Add the fish and simmer.
Stir in coconut milk and cilantro before serving.

title: Ajiaco Colombiano
description: Hearty chicken and potato soup with corn and herbs, traditional in Bogotá.
author: Sofia Gutierrez

steps.description: Cook the chicken with water, salt, and spices.
Add potatoes, corn on the cob, and guascas.
When the potatoes are soft, add cream and serve.

title: Tacos al Pastor
description: Mexican tacos with marinated pork, pineapple, and cilantro, served on corn tortillas.
author: Luis Morales

steps.description: Marinate the pork in achiote, garlic, and pineapple juice.
Cook the meat on a vertical spit or grill.
Slice the meat and serve in tortillas with pineapple and cilantro.

title: Enchiladas Verdes
description: Corn tortillas filled with chicken and covered in green tomatillo sauce.
author: Patricia Gomez

steps.description: Cook the chicken and shred it.
Fill the tortillas with chicken and cheese.
Top the enchiladas with green sauce and more cheese.
Bake until the cheese melts.

title: Flan de Leche
description: Creamy caramel custard dessert, popular throughout Latin America.
author: Ana Castillo

steps.description: Caramelize sugar and coat the flan mold.
Blend milk, eggs, and sugar until mixed.
Pour the mixture into the caramelized mold.
Bake in a water bath until set.

title: Pollo a la Brasa
description: Peruvian rotisserie chicken marinated with spices, served with fries and salad.
author: Miguel Santos

steps.description: Marinate the chicken with garlic, soy sauce, and spices.
Roast the chicken in an oven or on a grill.
Serve with french fries and salad.
